BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CLIFFORD W BEERS GUIDANCE CLINIC INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OUTPATIENT CLINIC PROVIDING COMMUNITY BASED MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE INTEGRATED SERVICES ADDRESSING MENTAL, PHYSICAL, AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH, RESILIENCY, AND QUALITY OF LIFE OF CHILDREN, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: CLIFFORD BEERS PROVIDES A BROAD RANGE OF OUTPATIENT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES INCLUDING TRADITIONAL OUTPATIENT THERAPY, SPECIALIZED SERVICES TO TARGET PROBLEM SEXUAL BEHAVIOR, SCHOOL-BASED HEALTH CLINICS TO MORE EASILY REACH CHILDREN, AND COMMUNITY DRIVEN CRISIS WORK.. ALL CLINIC PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ARE DESIGNED TO RESPOND TO THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND, THEREFORE, MORPH AS NEEDED. THE CLINIC USES A TRAUMA-INFORMED APPROACH TO CARE, SERVING 18+ TOWNS/CITIES IN THE GREATER NEW HAVEN AREA.CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE OEMPS CRISIS SERVICES IS A 24/7 HOTLINE (2-1-1) FOR FAMILIES FACING A CRISIS BUT NOT LIFE-THREATENING SITUATION (E.G., SIGNIFICANT SAFETY ISSUE, THREATS OF SUICIDE, DESTRUCTION TO PROPERTY). CARE COORDINATION IS FOR FAMILIES AT RISK OF HAVING CHILDREN PLACED IN RESIDENTIAL CARE AND AIMS TO COLLABORATE WITH FAMILIES, COMMUNITY SUPPORTS, AND OTHER PROVIDERS TO COORDINATE THE FAMILY'S CARE AND EMPOWER THE FAMILY TO ADVOCATE FOR THEMSELVES.CHILD FIRST IS AN EVIDENCE-BASED IN-HOME PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN 0-5 WHO ARE AT HIGH RISK FOR ABUSE OR NEGLECT. THE CLINIC GUIDES/SUPPORTS NEW PARENTS TO FOSTER BOTH THE PARENT-CHILD CONNECTION AND THE CHILD'S DEVELOPMENT. CHILD FIRST ALSO CONSULTS WITH PRESCHOOLS AND DAY CARE CENTERS ON ISSUES REGARDING THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NEEDS OF YOUNG CHILDREN.SCHOOL-BASED HEALTH CLINICS ARE IN FOUR SCHOOLS. ON-SITE LOCALES HELP OVERCOME FINANCIAL, CULTURAL, TRANSPORTATION AND STIGMA BARRIERS TO CARE.JOTLAB (JUVENILES OPTING FOR TREATMENT TO LEARN APPROPRIATE BEHAVIORS) OFFERS TREATMENT FOR CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS ENGAGING IN PROBLEM SEXUAL BEHAVIOR OR AT-RISK BEHAVIOR. TREATMENT CAN FOLLOW TRADITIONAL WEEKLY OUTPATIENT THERAPY OR CAN BE AS MUCH AS 15 HOURS/WEEK VIA THE INTENSIVE OUTPATIENT (IOP) PROGRAM.PROJECT CATCH (COLLABORATION ADVOCACY AND TREATMENT FOR CHILDREN) FOCUSES ON THE TRAUMA OF SEXUAL ABUSE AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE. CATCH PROVIDES SUPPORT, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND ADVOCACY TO HELP CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES RECOVER FROM THESE TRAUMAS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CLINIC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS APPROVED A SPENDING POLICY THAT EVALUATES AN ANNUAL SPENDING TARGET OF 4.25% OF THE AVERAGE QUARTERLY ENDING MARKET VALUE OVER THE PRECEDING TWENTY QUARTERS. THIS IS CONSISTENT WITH THE CLINIC'S OBJECTIVE TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS HELD IN PERPETUITY, AS WELL AS TO PROVIDE REAL GROWTH THROUGH NEW GIFTS AND INVESTMENT RETURN.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FORM 990 14,275.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FORM 990 14,275.

REASON FOR AMENDED RETURN: MANAGEMENT IS FILING AN AMENDED RETURN FOR THE JUNE 30, 2022 YEAR END DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE FINANCIAL INFORMATION THAT WAS INCLUDED IN THE ORIGINALLY FILED RETURN WAS NOT FULLY RECONCILED. ADDITIONAL TIME WAS NEEDED IN ORDER TO PROPERLY RECONCILE THE ACCOUNTS OF THE ORGANIZATION IN ORDER TO REFLECT OPERATIONS FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022. PART VIII, IX, X AND XI WERE UPDATED TO REFLECT THE PROPER BALANCES OF ALL ACCOUNTS. SCHEDULES A, B AND PARTS XI AND XII OF SCHEDULE D WERE ALSO UPDATED TO CORRELATE TO THE CHANGES MADE IN THE PREVIOUS DISCLOSED SECTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE REVIEW PROCESS OF THE FORM 990 IS DONE BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. AFTER THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE'S APPROVAL PROCESS IS COMMUNICATED TO THE BOARD, AND A COPY IS PROVIDED TO EACH BOARD MEMBER. EACH BOARD MEMEBER HAS AN OPPORTUNITY TO REVIEW THE FORM 990 BEFORE THE FINAL REPORT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CLINIC HAS A FORMAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THAT DESCRIBES SPECIFIC CONFLICTS THAT WOULD NEED TO BE DISCLOSED IF THEY WERE APPLICABLE. ALL DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT IN THE FORM THAT HAS BEEN APPROVED BY THE BOARD, PRIOR TO TAKING OFFICE OR ACCEPTING NOMINATION AS A DIRECTOR OR OFFICER AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER; AND SHALL HAVE A CONTINUING RESPONSIBILITY TO DISCLOSE TO THE CORPORATION AS SOON AS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT IS KNOWN, SUCH POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISING DURING THEIR TENURE AS AN OFFICER OR DIRECTOR. THE SECRETARY OF THE CORPORATION KEEPS ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ON FILE IN THE CORPORATE RECORDS. THE SECRETARY OF THE CORPORATION REVIEWS EACH NEW, ANNUAL OR AMENDED STATEMENT, AND WHEN REQUESTED TO DO SO SHALL CAUSE ANY SUBSTANTIAL FINANCIAL OR OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN ANY OTHER ENTITY WITH THIS CORPORATION CONTRACTS TO BE DISCLOSED TO ALL STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, INLUDING MEDICAID AUTHORITIES, WHICH ARE ENTITLED TO REQUEST AND RECEIVE THIS INFORMATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: YES, THE CLINIC UTILIZED A SEARCH FIRM THAT CONDUCTED A NATIONAL SEARCH TO FILL THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR POSITION IN 2007. AS PART OF THAT PROCESS, THE SEARCH FIRM ASSISTED WITH ESTABLISHING THE COMPENSATION RANGE, EVALUATING THE CANDIDATES, AND PREPARED SUMMARY DOCUMENTATION FOR THE FINAL CANDIDATES, AND PREPARED SUMMARY DOCUMENTATION FOR THE FINAL CANDIDATES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD WORKED CLOSELY WITH THE SEARCH FIRM TO REACH THE FINAL DECISION AND STRUCTURE THE FINAL EMPLOYMENT OFFER. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION IS BASED ON HER CONTRACT. ADDITIONALLY, THE CLINIC UTILIZES INDUSTRY DATA PREPARED BY THE CONNECTICUT COMMUNITY PROVIDERS ASSOCIATION TO EVALUATE AND BENCHMARK MARKET COMPENSATION FOR THE OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IN THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER THAN THE INFORMATION DISCLOSED IN THE ANNUAL FORM 990 REPORT, THE CLINIC DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. THE CLINIC MAKES ITS AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO FUNDERS AS PART OF GRANT FUNDING OR BANK LOAN REQUESTS THAT ARE EVALUATED AND DETERMINED TO BE APPROPRIATE AND NECESSARY.
OTHER PROFESSIONAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 2,447,848. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 454,904. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 30,709. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,933,461.
